ld:field.comment: default 0 - sparring msgs are 0/1, announcements are 4
default 0 - sometimes randomly set to 1 or 2

ld:field.name: extents
ld:field.comment: 0 - not room; 1 in stockpile; 2 wall; 3 inner; 4 distance boundary.

ld:field.name: construction_stage
ld:field.comment: 0 not started, then 1 or 3 max depending on type

ld:field.name: owner
ld:field.comment: type uncertain - not a unit ID or unit pointer

enum-item.name: BAR
enum-item.comment: Bars, such as metal, fuel, or soap.

enum-item.name: SMALLGEM
enum-item.comment: Cut gemstones usable in jewelers workshop

enum-item.name: CORPSE
enum-item.comment: Corpses. Does not have a material.

enum-item.name: ARMOR
enum-item.comment: Armor and clothing worn on the upper body.

enum-item.name: SHOES
enum-item.comment: Armor and clothing worn on the feet.

enum-item.name: HELM
enum-item.comment: Armor and clothing worn on the head.

enum-item.name: GLOVES
enum-item.comment: Armor and clothing worn on the hands.

enum-item.name: BOX
enum-item.comment: Chests (wood), coffers (stone), boxes (glass), and bags (cloth or leather).

enum-item.name: CORPSEPIECE
enum-item.comment: Body parts. Does not have a material.

enum-item.name: REMAINS
enum-item.comment: Dead vermin bodies. Material is CREATURE_ID:CASTE.

enum-item.name: THREAD
enum-item.comment: Thread gathered from webs or made at the farmers workshop.

enum-item.name: PANTS
enum-item.comment: Armor and clothing worn on the legs.

enum-item.name: POWDER_MISC
enum-item.comment: Powders such as flour, gypsum plaster, dye, or sand.

enum-item.name: FOOD
enum-item.comment: Prepared meals. Subtypes come from item_food.txt

enum-item.name: LIQUID_MISC
enum-item.comment: Liquids such as water, lye, and extracts.

enum-item.name: GLOB
enum-item.comment: Fat, tallow, pastes/pressed objects, and small bits of molten rock/metal.

enum-item.name: ROCK
enum-item.comment: Small rocks (usually sharpened and/or thrown in adventurer mode)

ld:field.name: ID
ld:field.comment: race, item type, plant ID, or shape ID

ld:field.name: in_job
ld:field.comment: Item currently being used in a job

ld:field.name: in_inventory
ld:field.comment: Item in a creature or workshop inventory

ld:field.name: in_building
ld:field.comment: Part of a building (including mechanisms, bodies in coffins)

ld:field.name: dead_dwarf
ld:field.comment: Dwarfs dead body or body part

ld:field.name: murder
ld:field.comment: Implies murder - used in fell moods

ld:field.name: owned
ld:field.comment: Item is owned by a dwarf

ld:field.name: garbage_colect
ld:field.comment: Marked for deallocation by DF it seems

ld:field.name: on_fire
ld:field.comment: Indicates if item is on fire, Will Set Item On Fire if Set!

ld:field.name: working
ld:field.comment: not for food, or store in sp

ld:field.name: fetching
ld:field.comment: Actually going out to bring; corresponds to items->is_fetching

ld:field.name: special
ld:field.comment: Sleep/Drink/Eat/Clean; cannot be aborted via the ui

ld:field.name: bringing
ld:field.comment: When actually carrying non-last item to the workshop. If last, 'working' is used instead.

ld:field.name: is_fetching
ld:field.comment: 0 immediately once taken to be brought

ld:field.name: deep_material
ld:field.comment: check for inorganic material flag DEEP

ld:field.name: no_melt_dump
ld:field.comment: item must not be designated for melting or dumping

ld:field.name: plant
ld:field.comment: check if material is a PLANT_MAT

ld:field.name: any_raw_material
ld:field.comment: itemtype BAR, BOULDER, POWDER_MISC, or GLOB

ld:field.name: any_craft
ld:field.comment: FIGURINE, AMULET, SCEPTER, CROWN, RING, EARRING, BRACLET

ld:field.name: timeout_limit
ld:field.comment: once counter passes limit, mandate ends

ld:global-type.code-helper: (when $.has_name (let* ((nick $.nickname) (language $global.world.raws.translations[$.language]) (english $global.world.raws.language_words) (fname $.first_name) (lwords $language.words)) (flet ((get-words (start end) (loop for i from start to end for word = $.words[i] collect $lwords[word].value)) (get-english (start end) (loop for i from start to end for word = $.words[i] and ps = $.parts_of_speech[i] collect $english[word].forms[ps]))) (list (fmt "Name:~:(~@[ ~A~]~@[ '~A'~]~@[ ~{~A~}~]~@[ ~{~A~}~]~@[ ~{~A~}~]~)" (if (> (length fname) 0) fname) (if (> (length nick) 0) nick) (flatten (get-words 0 1)) (flatten (get-words 2 5)) (flatten (get-words 6 6))) (fmt "aka~:(~@[ ~A~]~@[ ~{~A~}~]~@[ the ~A~]~@[ of ~{~A~}~]~)" (if (> (length fname) 0) fname) (flatten (get-english 0 1)) (when (>= $.words[5] 0) (apply #'format nil "~@[~A ~]~@[~A ~]~@[~A-~]~A" (get-english 2 5))) (flatten (get-english 6 6)))))))

ld:field.name: connections
ld:field.comment: indices into the same component vector

enum-item.name: Default
enum-item.comment: dig walls, remove stairs and ramps, gather plants, fell trees

ld:field.name: edge_flow_in
ld:field.comment: if set on an edge tile, water or magma will flow in

ld:field.name: monster_lair
ld:field.comment: A monster lair. Items placed wont be moved.

ld:field.name: no_grow
ld:field.comment: seems to be set on terrain tiles where grass growth is impossible

enum-item.name: UpdateLiquidTwice
enum-item.comment: Protects UpdateLiquid from being cleared the first time.

ld:data-definition.ld:global-type:
-- Guess:
-- Either empty, or same as above:
-- These are equal to the ones above:

ld:field.name: alias
ld:field.comment: if not empty, used instead of name

ld:field.name: fall_counter
ld:field.comment: counts down from delay to 0, then it moves

ld:data-definition.ld:global-type:
-- Materials
-- Inorganic
-- Plants
dtor 852cc20
-- Creature RAWs
dtor 89bab50
dtor 8527e40
dtor 89ba980
-- Creatures
dtor 81448c0
-- Item RAWs
dtor 852e080
-- Entity RAWs
-- Language RAWs
dtor 852bc90
-- Words
-- Reaction RAWs
-- Workshops
-- Material index

ld:field.name: end_x
ld:field.comment: only valid for an instant while its being completed

ld:global-type.comment: When creating a building, one record per required item type. E.g. Soap Maker's workshop requires a bucket and a building material.
One choice in the build item selector.

ld:field.name: move_state
ld:field.comment: Can the dwarf move or are they waiting for their movement timer

ld:field.name: dead
ld:field.comment: Dead (might also be set for incoming/leaving critters that are alive)

ld:field.name: marauder
ld:field.comment: wide class of invader/inside creature attackers

ld:field.name: forest
ld:field.comment: used for units no longer linked to merchant/diplomacy, they just try to leave mostly

ld:field.name: can_swap
ld:field.comment: Can swap tiles during movement (prevents multiple swaps)

ld:field.name: on_ground
ld:field.comment: The creature is laying on the floor, can be conscious

ld:field.name: invader_origin
ld:field.comment: Invader origin (could be inactive and fleeing)

ld:field.name: coward
ld:field.comment: Will flee if invasion turns around

ld:field.name: invades
ld:field.comment: Marauder resident/invader moving in all the way

ld:field.name: check_flows
ld:field.comment: Check against flows next time you get a chance

ld:field.name: no_notify
ld:field.comment: Do not notify about level gains (for embark etc)

ld:field.name: killed
ld:field.comment: Has been killed by kill function (slightly different from dead, not necessarily violent death)

ld:field.name: cleanup_1
ld:field.comment: Must be forgotten by forget function (just cleanup)

ld:field.name: locked_in_for_trading
ld:field.comment: Locked in for trading (it's a projectile on the other set of flags, might be what the flying was)

ld:field.name: cleanup_4
ld:field.comment: Marked for special cleanup as unused load from unit block on disk

ld:field.name: unk0
ld:field.comment: Is 1 for new and dead creatures, periodicaly set to 0 for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: unk1
ld:field.comment: Is 1 for new creatures, periodically set to 0 for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: unk2
ld:field.comment: Is set to 1 every tick for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: unk3
ld:field.comment: Is periodically set to 0 for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: announce_titan
ld:field.comment: Announces creature like an FB or titan.

ld:field.name: unk8
ld:field.comment: Is set to 1 every tick for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: unk9
ld:field.comment: Is set to 0 every tick for non-dead creatures.

ld:field.name: scuttle
ld:field.comment: Scuttle creature: causes creature to be killed, leaving a behind corpse and generating negative thoughts like a real kill.

ld:field.name: old_x
ld:field.comment: E.g. for a dead miner, holds the place where he was likely hanging around when he got the command to mine in an aquifer.

ld:field.name: animal_leave_countdown
ld:field.comment: once 0, it heads for the edge and leaves

ld:field.name: old_year
ld:field.comment: could there be a death of old age time??

ld:global-type.ld:field: -- If shot by a ranged weapon:

ld:field.name: corpse_parts
ld:field.comment: entries remain even when items are destroyed
